description: From Middle English begynner, equivalent to begin +‎ -er. Cognate with West Frisian begjinner (“beginner”), Dutch beginner (“beginner”), Low German begünner (“beginner”), Danish nybegynder (“beginner, novice”, literally “new-beginner”).

entries.meaning: Someone who is just starting at something, or has only recently started.
examples: I'm new to learning Finnish: I'm just a beginner.

entries.meaning: Someone who sets something in motion.
examples: The beginner of the games lit the ceremonial torch.

entries.meaning: (theater) An actor who is present on stage in the first moments of a play.
examples: On the stage, the beginners for the first piece had taken their places — the chorus were there, scared but determined, and in the wings waited Harlequin, in the person of Charles Lyall  […]
